conbody.p: RPC pipelinesconfiguration guidelinesTo create a valid set of RPC pipelines, some configuration options must be aligned. Use the following guidelines to configure RPC pipelines:

dlentry.dd:
In the origin pipeline, configure the following elements:
In the pipeline properties, set the Delivery Guarantee to the option you want to use.
In the pipeline, use the RPC destination.
When you configure the RPC destination, enter the RPC ID and RPC connection information.
To use multiple destination pipelines, enter the RPC connection information for each RPC origin that you want to use.
To use SSL to transfer data between the pipelines, enable SSL and configure related properties.

For each destination pipeline, configure the following elements:
In the pipeline properties, set the Delivery Guarantee to the same option as the origin pipeline. Using a different option causes the to default to At Least Once.
In the pipeline, use the RPC origin.
When you configure the RPC origin, define the properties as follows:
Use the same RPC ID used in the RPC destination.
For the RPC Listening Port, enter the appropriate port number.
It should be a port number specified in one of the RPC connections in the RPC destination.
To use SSL to transfer data between the pipelines, enable SSL and configure related properties.
